intro: Miconia manicata subsp. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian miconia, is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers, which are often followed by bright red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
